headline.main: Prosecutor to Appeal Lighter Sentence for Girl's Attacker
headline.print_headline: Prosecutor to Appeal Lighter Sentence for Girl's Attacker

docs.snippet: A California district attorney said Wednesday that he will appeal a judge's decision to give a lighter sentence to a man who sodomized a 3-year-old girl....
docs.lead_paragraph: A California district attorney said Wednesday that he will appeal a judge's decision to give a lighter sentence to a man who sodomized a 3-year-old girl.

headline.main: Obama Calls for End to Gay 'Conversion' Therapy for Youth
headline.print_headline: Obama Calls for End to Gay 'Conversion' Therapy for Youth

docs.snippet: President Barack Obama is calling for an end to psychiatric therapy treatments aimed at changing the sexual orientation or gender identity of gay, lesbian and transgender youth....
docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama is calling for an end to psychiatric therapy treatments aimed at changing the sexual orientation or gender identity of gay, lesbian and transgender youth.

headline.main: GM Mulls $1.3 Billion Expansion of Texas Assembly Plant
headline.print_headline: GM Mulls $1.3 Billion Expansion of Texas Assembly Plant

docs.snippet: General Motors Co is mulling a $1.3 billion expansion of its Arlington, Texas, assembly plant to boost production of its sport-utility vehicles, according to documents from the city....
docs.lead_paragraph: General Motors Co is mulling a $1.3 billion expansion of its Arlington, Texas, assembly plant to boost production of its sport-utility vehicles, according to documents from the city.

headline.main: Obama Calls for End to Conversion Therapy for LGBT Youth
headline.print_headline: Obama Calls for End to Conversion Therapy for LGBT Youth

docs.snippet: U.S. President Barack Obama called on Wednesday for an end to psychiatric therapies that seek to change the sexual orientation of gay, lesbian and transgender youth, the White House said....
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. President Barack Obama called on Wednesday for an end to psychiatric therapies that seek to change the sexual orientation of gay, lesbian and transgender youth, the White House said.

headline.main: South Carolina Police Shooting Reflects Racist Pattern, Residents Say
headline.print_headline: South Carolina Police Shooting Reflects Racist Pattern, Residents Say

docs.snippet: For the dozens of protesters who descended on the working-class South Carolina city of North Charleston on Wednesday, a bystander's video of a white police officer gunning down a fleeing black man was long-awaited confirmation of what many residen...
docs.lead_paragraph: For the dozens of protesters who descended on the working-class South Carolina city of North Charleston on Wednesday, a bystander's video of a white police officer gunning down a fleeing black man was long-awaited confirmation of what many residents have been saying for years.

headline.main: Half of Countries Miss 2015 Goal of Primary Schooling for All: UNESCO
headline.print_headline: Half of Countries Miss 2015 Goal of Primary Schooling for All: UNESCO

docs.snippet: Only half of countries have achieved a global target of getting all children into primary school by 2015, some 58 million youngsters are still getting no education at all, but more girls are going to school, the United Nations said on Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Only half of countries have achieved a global target of getting all children into primary school by 2015, some 58 million youngsters are still getting no education at all, but more girls are going to school, the United Nations said on Thursday.

headline.main: Factbox: Winners and Losers in the Race to Get Children Into School
headline.print_headline: Factbox: Winners and Losers in the Race to Get Children Into School

docs.snippet: A major U.N. review of global progress on meeting key education targets by 2015 was published on Thursday. Here is a report card on some of the countries working hardest and those failing to make the grade....
docs.lead_paragraph: A major U.N. review of global progress on meeting key education targets by 2015 was published on Thursday. Here is a report card on some of the countries working hardest and those failing to make the grade.

headline.main: Asia's LGBT People Migrate to Escape Violence at Home
headline.print_headline: Asia's LGBT People Migrate to Escape Violence at Home

docs.snippet: Long before Joe Wong surgically removed his breasts and uterus, he was Joleen, who once used an entire roll of brown duct tape to flatten her chest in an effort to look less feminine at her new secondary school in Singapore....
docs.lead_paragraph: Long before Joe Wong surgically removed his breasts and uterus, he was Joleen, who once used an entire roll of brown duct tape to flatten her chest in an effort to look less feminine at her new secondary school in Singapore.
